image.altText: Primary school in the ACT generic

props.synopsis: Two schools are completely closed, and another eight have partial closures as the clean-up of coloured sand products continues.

title.children: Ten schools to remain at least partially closed in the ACT

image.altText: A drawing using coloured sand.

props.synopsis: A Canberra mother who used coloured sand to celebrate Diwali in her backyard wants more help from WorkSafe ACT after being advised to cordon off the area, a thoroughfare to her home, and call an asbestos company.

title.children: Woman told to cordon off backyard, access to house, after using coloured sand

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal family members.

props.synopsis: The family of a 17-year-old Indigenous boy say he was racially profiled when he was pulled from a Canberra bus by police officers who handcuffed him before realising he was the wrong person.

title.children: Aboriginal teen mistakenly pulled from bus at gunpoint after 'racial profiling'

image.altText: A smiling man fixing a bicycle

props.synopsis: Harri Jokinen is one of several people who died from accidents during pursuits involving NSW Police.

title.children: 'I was killed too': Police pursuit death wrecks ACT family

image.altText: The father of the victim standing outside court.

props.synopsis: A court prepares to sentence a speeding, drug-affected driver who was on the wrong side of the road before a fatal crash.

title.children: Tom says he felt his son's death was mocked as court prepares to sentence woman

image.altText: ACT Ambulance Service

props.synopsis: An internal review has revealed the service needs at least 80 additional ambulance officers, response times are worsening, and night shifts are failing to meet minimum staffing levels 96 per cent of the time.

title.children: ACT ambulance officer shortages could be 'difference between life and death'

image.altText: Alicia Jauregui

props.synopsis: A P-plater in an uninsured, unregistered and unroadworthy vehicle hit and killed a cyclist last year. Today, he was jailed.

title.children: P-plater in unregistered and unroadworthy vehicle jailed over fatal crash

image.altText: ACT Australian of the Year Rose McGready.

props.synopsis: Rose McGready has been living in a refugee camp for more than 30 years, having dedicated her life to saving the lives of vulnerable women and children.

title.children: Dr McGready honoured for 30 years spent working with mums in Myanmar

image.altText: Gif showing illustration of a house with household items and a fighter jet flying above.

props.synopsis: Take a tour around the house and see how everyday life is powered by critical minerals and why we will keep hearing so much about them.

title.children: Here are the critical minerals hiding in every room of your home

image.altText: A man wearing a black suit smiles.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese arrives in Johannesburg in South Africa for the G20 summit. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese arrives in South Africa for the G20 summit

image.altText: A drone explodes during a Russian missile and drone strike in kyiv

props.synopsis: European allies of Kyiv say "peace cannot be capitulation" as details of a new plan to end the Ukraine war emerge.

title.children: 'Capitulation': Everything we know about new US plans to end war in Ukraine

image.altText: A woman with brown shoulder-length hair sits looking away from the camera with people sitting behind her

props.synopsis: Former mayor Alice Guo has generated headlines for years in the Philippines. Now, her story might have come to an end.

title.children: How a mayor suspected of spying for China ended up in jail

image.altText: Sussan Ley speak to the media.

props.synopsis: The opposition has identified seven key areas where change would be required for the Coalition to support Labor's proposed reforms to the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act.

title.children: Coalition would back Labor's environment laws with 'sensible' amendments

image.altText: Steve Smith and Ben Stokes stand on the Perth Stadium outfield in their whites and blazers while holding the Ashes trophy

props.synopsis: The build-up to this Ashes series has been long and often painful, but will quickly be forgotten when the first bowl is bowled and all hell breaks loose today.

title.children: The Ashes build-up has been predictable. The cricket will be anything but

image.altText: Six men in military uniform carry a casket draped in the US flag.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden, George Bush and every living former vice-president — Kamala Harris, Mike Pence, Al Gore and Dan Quayle — were in attendance, along with generals, foreign dignitaries and Supreme Court justices.

title.children: US elite gathers for Dick Cheney's funeral but Trump and Vance not invited

image.altText: A woman with medium-length brown hair wearing a black blazer looks confidently at the camera while another person speaks.

props.synopsis: The ABC has confirmed shadow Attorney-General Alister Henskens, who was Vaucluse MP Kellie Sloane's main challenger, has withdrawn from the race for the NSW Liberal leadership position.

title.children: Breaking: Kellie Sloane expected to be new NSW Liberal leader as Henskens bows out

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Six Democratic politicians, all of whom are veterans, are urging members of the military not to obey unlawful orders.

title.children: Trump floats death penalty for Democrats urging military to refuse illegal orders

image.altText: The weather bureau's cyclone track map

props.synopsis: The BOM's latest track map shows Tropical Cyclone Fina has been temporarily downgraded to a category one system, but could still intensify to a category three by Saturday afternoon.

title.children: NT's Cyclone Fina may be category three when it reaches Darwin, BOM says

image.altText: A hot pink sky with flicks of yellow over a field.

props.synopsis: Did you catch the finer details of this week's news? Quiz yourself!

title.children: Weekly news quiz: The ARIA Awards, a golden auction and aurora australis

image.altText: More than a dozen empty bunkbeds in a dormitory.

props.synopsis: The kidnappers arrived on motorcycles, scaled the school fence and shot the vice-principal as he tried to protect his students.

title.children: Nigeria grapples with mass abductions of schoolgirls

image.altText: Archie Ludowyke pictured representing the national academy

props.synopsis: Archie Ludowyke goes to his bedroom thinking he is not going to get his AFL dream realised, only to to hear an eruption from his living room as his name is called out by the Adelaide Crows.

title.children: Heartbroken draftee retreats to room in tears, misses moment he is picked

image.altText: A long old submarine in the water

props.synopsis: The discovery of narco subs bearing the hallmarks of boats used by Mexican and South American drug cartels has intensified warnings that international syndicates are increasingly targeting the lucrative Australian and New Zealand illicit drug markets.

title.children: Escalating gangland violence tied to growing illicit drug trade

image.altText: A mother giving her daughter pills out of a square bottle.

props.synopsis: As ADHD diagnoses rise, Australia's peak body for psychiatrists are calling for a national system to monitor and stop potential over-diagnosis of the condition.

title.children: Oversight of ADHD diagnoses needed as GP powers expand, peak body says

image.altText: graphic representation of children holding hands and toys

props.synopsis: An inquiry into the state's "broken" child protection system hears from staff who work at the child safety department.

title.children: 'Drastic act' scrutinised as Queensland's child safety inquiry continues

image.altText: A man holds a placard that reads: "America wants the truth".

props.synopsis: As a 30-day timer begins for the US Department of Justice to release its Epstein files, questions remain around whether this will be the definitive release.

title.children: How politicians could combat doubts about Epstein files release

image.altText: Volcanic rocks an ask sit in front of a damaged house as people inspect the damage

props.synopsis: Mount Semeru's sudden eruption left more than 170 people on its slopes in danger, while nearby residents fled for safety.

title.children: Climbers rescued off erupting volcano as 1,000 locals evacuated

image.altText: A bottle of sparkling wine is about to be poured

props.synopsis: A breakthrough in long-stalled negotiations over a free trade deal between Australia and the European Union could come as soon as this weekend, sources have told the ABC.

title.children: Years-long trade deadlock with EU may be nearing breakthrough

image.altText: Man with beard in front of the bay.

props.synopsis: An elder in an Aboriginal community exposed to PFAS contamination says the town is proof of the health risks of "forever chemicals", as a federal inquiry recommends widespread testing to establish a link.

title.children: Elder in PFAS hotspot attends more than 20 funerals in two years

image.altText: Anthony Albanese (4)

props.synopsis: The prime minister didn't seem too bothered as he sold Australia losing out on the rights to host a major climate summit as a win.

title.children: Knives out as Hanson cooks it and Albanese cops it

image.altText: The waxwork of late Britain's Princess Diana is presented in a museum

props.synopsis: The late Princess is displayed wearing a copy of the black gown by designer Christina Stambolian that she wore for a public appearance in 1994 amid a media frenzy about the breakdown of her marriage to Charles.

title.children: Princess Diana enters Paris waxwork museum in 'revenge dress'

image.altText: A large white ferry sits in the water and up against a small island at night

props.synopsis: South Korean authorities have detained two crew members after the ferry carrying 267 passengers crashed into an island.

title.children: Ferry operator crashed vessel because he was distracted by his phone

image.altText: A small dachshund running over grass.

props.synopsis: A 44-year-old woman is fined almost $2,000 after she tried to insert a bag of methylamphetamine into her dog's body.

title.children: Woman fined after attempting to hide bag of meth in her sausage dog

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair, wearing a black dress, and with tattoos on her arms, stands next to a Parliament of Victoria sign.

props.synopsis: The Animal Justice Party MP detailed her own experiences during a debate over legislation to restrict the use of non-disclosure agreements in workplace sexual harassment cases.

title.children: MP Georgie Purcell details sexual harassment in Victorian parliament

image.altText: Nathan McKeown Arnie the German shepherd

props.synopsis: Queensland Police had been investigating the alleged theft of a vehicle and Arnie the German shepherd, from Brisbane's bayside.

title.children: Owner charged over allegedly abandoning dog Arnie after claiming he was stolen

image.altText: Julia Morris, left, poses in a composite image next to Guy Sebastian, right, doing the same.

props.synopsis: Stars including Anne Edmonds, Sam Pang and Shaun Tan are attached to the ABC's 2026 line-up with old audience favourites and new series coming next year.

title.children: ABC unveils 2026 line-up with new faces Julia Morris and Guy Sebastian
